extendedIngredients.name: bay leaves
extendedIngredients.original: 1 (1-pound) head escarole, trimmed of any tough or discolored leaves and remainder (including ribs) cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces (about 10 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: belgian endive
extendedIngredients.original: 1 pound Belgian endive (2 to 4), cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces, discarding cores (4 cups)

title: Quick Sauteed Endive, Escarole, and Frisée
summary: Quick Sauteed Endive, Escarole, and Frisée might be just the side dish you are searching for. One serving contains 279 calories, 5g of protein, and 15g of fat. This caveman, gluten free, primal, and fodmap friendly recipe serves 8 and costs $11.42 per serving. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. Head to the store and pick up discolored leaves and remainder cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces, belgian endive, salt, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 35 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 87%, this dish is super. Similar recipes are Fennel, Frisée, and Escarole Salad, Frisée and Endive Salad with Olive Vinaigrette, and Endive And Frisee Salad With Truffle Vinaigrette.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Toss greens together, then divide into  2 batches.                                                                Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then add  1 batch of greens, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/40 teaspoon pepper and sauté, tossing with 2 wooden spatulas or tongs, until evenly wilted but still crunchy, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and  add 2 teaspoons lemon juice, tossing to coat. Transfer to a serving dish.                                                                Repeat procedure with remaining  oil, greens, salt, pepper, and lemon juice.

steps.step: Toss greens together, then divide into  2 batches.

Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a 12-inch nonstick skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then add  1 batch of greens, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/40 teaspoon pepper and sauté, tossing with 2 wooden spatulas or tongs, until evenly wilted but still crunchy, about 2 minutes.
Remove from heat and  add 2 teaspoons lemon juice, tossing to coat.
Repeat procedure with remaining  oil, greens, salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
